metadata.title: CVE-2021-3772 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux SCTP stack. A blind attacker may be able tokill an existing SCTP association through invalid chunks if the attackerknows the IP-addresses and port numbers being used and the attacker cansend packets with spoofed IP addresses.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3772` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-lowlatency - 4.4.0-239.273
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-184-generic - 4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-184-generic - 4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-184-lowlatency - 4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1118-kvm - 4.4.0-1118.128
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1155-aws - 4.4.0-1155.170
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1133-aws - 4.15.0-1133.143~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1142-azure - 4.15.0-1142.156~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1127-gcp - 4.15.0-1127.142~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1098-oracle - 4.15.0-1098.108~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1088-fips - 4.4.0-1088.95
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1088-fips - 4.4.0-1088.95
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1088-fips - 4.4.0-1088.95
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1088-fips - 4.4.0-1088.95
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-239.273').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-184.194~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1118.128').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1155.170').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1133.143~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1142.156~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1127.142~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1098.108~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1088.95').
